intro: Pentas carnea var. hortensis, commonly known as the red pentas, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its dense clusters of small, five-petaled flowers that are typically bright red or pink in color. The plant has a compact, bushy growth habit and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and ability to attract pollinators. The leaves are opposite, simple, and have a slightly hairy texture.
